TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed DebuggableAttribute/DebuggingModes extends System.Enum

summary.span: Specifies the debugging mode for the just-in-time (JIT) compiler.

span.span: Specifies the debugging mode for the just-in-time (JIT) compiler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks O enumeração Especifica como o tempo de execução rastrear as informações importantes para o depurador durante a geração de código.The enumeration specifies how the runtime is to track information important to the debugger during code generation. Essas informações ajudam o depurador oferecer uma experiência de depuração.This information helps the debugger provide a rich debugging experience. Diferentemente do .NET Framework versão 1.1, versões 2.0 ou posteriores não permitem que você desativar o controle pelo compilador just-in-time (JIT).Unlike the .NET Framework version 1.1, versions 2.0 or later do not allow you to turn off tracking by the just-in-time (JIT) compiler. Controle de JIT sempre está habilitado para arquivos de recurso.JIT tracking is always enabled for debuggable files. Na versão 2.0 e posteriores, os valores de enumeração têm o seguinte efeito.In version 2.0 and later, the enumeration values have the following effect. |Modo de depuraçãoDebugging mode|ResultadoResult| |--------------------|------------| |NenhumNone|Controle, otimizações JIT habilitadoTracking on, JIT optimizations enabled| |PadrãoDefault|Controle, otimizações JIT habilitadoTracking on, JIT optimizations enabled| |DisableOptimizationsDisableOptimizations|Controle, otimizações JIT habilitadoTracking on, JIT optimizations enabled| |Padrão | DisableOptimizationsDefault | DisableOptimizations|Controle, otimizações JIT desabilitadoTracking on, JIT optimizations disabled| Pontos de sequência são usadas para indicar os locais em que o código do Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) que um usuário do depurador esperam poder referir-se exclusivamente, por exemplo, para definir um ponto de interrupção.Sequence points are used to indicate locations in the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) code that a debugger user will expect to be able to refer to uniquely, such as for setting a breakpoint. O compilador JIT garante que ele não compila o MSIL em dois pontos de sequência diferentes em uma única instrução nativo.The JIT compiler ensures it does not compile the MSIL at two different sequence points into a single native instruction. Por padrão, o compilador JIT examina o armazenamento de símbolo de arquivo de programa (PDB) de banco de dados para obter uma lista de pontos de sequência adicional.By default, the JIT compiler examines the symbol store in the program database (PDB) file for a list of additional sequence points. No entanto, ao carregar PDB arquivo requer que o arquivo esteja disponível e tem um impacto negativo no desempenho.However, loading the PDB file requires that the file be available and has a negative performance impact. Começando com a versão 2.0, compiladores podem emitir "pontos de sequência implícita" no fluxo de código MSIL com o uso de MSIL "`nop"` instruções.Starting with version 2.0, compilers can emit "implicit sequence points" in the MSIL code stream through the use of MSIL "`nop"` instructions. Tais compiladores devem definir o sinalizador de IgnoreSymbolStoreSequencePoints para notificar o common language runtime não carregar o arquivo PDB.Such compilers should set the IgnoreSymbolStoreSequencePoints flag to notify the common language runtime to not load the PDB file. > [!NOTE] > Essa enumeração é usada principalmente por desenvolvedores de idioma.This enumeration is primarily used by language developers. Ele é geralmente não usado no desenvolvimento de aplicativos.It is generally not used in application development. Ambientes de desenvolvimento usam com base em parâmetros de compilador como **/Debug** e **/Optimize**.Development environments use based on compiler parameters such as **/debug** and **/optimize**.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute/DebuggingModes Default = int32(1)

summary.span: Instructs the just-in-time (JIT) compiler to use its default behavior, which includes enabling optimizations, disabling Edit and Continue support, and using symbol store sequence points if present.

span.span: Instructs the just-in-time (JIT) compiler to use its default behavior, which includes enabling optimizations, disabling Edit and Continue support, and using symbol store sequence points if present.

summary.span: Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, JIT tracking information, the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) offset to the native-code offset within a method, is always generated.

span.span: Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, JIT tracking information, the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) offset to the native-code offset within a method, is always generated.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute/DebuggingModes DisableOptimizations = int32(256)

summary.span: Disable optimizations performed by the compiler to make your output file smaller, faster, and more efficient.

span.span: Disable optimizations performed by the compiler to make your output file smaller, faster, and more efficient.

summary.span: Optimizations result in code rearrangement in the output file, which can make debugging difficult.

span.span: Optimizations result in code rearrangement in the output file, which can make debugging difficult.

summary.span: Typically optimization should be disabled while debugging.

span.span: Typically optimization should be disabled while debugging.

summary.span: In versions 2.0 or later, combine this value with Default (Default | DisableOptimizations) to enable JIT tracking and disable optimizations.

span.span: In versions 2.0 or later, combine this value with Default (Default | DisableOptimizations) to enable JIT tracking and disable optimizations.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute/DebuggingModes EnableEditAndContinue = int32(4)

summary.span: Edit and continue enables you to make changes to your source code while your program is in break mode.

span.span: Edit and continue enables you to make changes to your source code while your program is in break mode.

summary.span: The ability to edit and continue is compiler dependent.

span.span: The ability to edit and continue is compiler dependent.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute/DebuggingModes IgnoreSymbolStoreSequencePoints = int32(2)

summary.span: Use the implicit MSIL sequence points, not the program database (PDB) sequence points.

span.span: Use the implicit MSIL sequence points, not the program database (PDB) sequence points.

summary.span: The symbolic information normally includes at least one Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) offset for each source line.

span.span: The symbolic information normally includes at least one Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) offset for each source line.

summary.span: When the just-in-time (JIT) compiler is about to compile a method, it asks the profiling services for a list of MSIL offsets that should be preserved.

span.span: When the just-in-time (JIT) compiler is about to compile a method, it asks the profiling services for a list of MSIL offsets that should be preserved.

summary.span: These MSIL offsets are called sequence points.

span.span: These MSIL offsets are called sequence points.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute/DebuggingModes None = int32(0)

summary.span: Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, JIT tracking information is always generated, and this flag has the same effect as , except that it sets the property to .

span.span: Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, JIT tracking information is always generated, and this flag has the same effect as , except that it sets the property to .

summary.span: However, because JIT tracking is always enabled, the property value is ignored in version 2.0 or later.

span.span: However, because JIT tracking is always enabled, the property value is ignored in version 2.0 or later.

summary.span: Note that, unlike the flag, the flag cannot be used to disable JIT optimizations.

span.span: Note that, unlike the flag, the flag cannot be used to disable JIT optimizations.
